description:
Astatotilapia calliptera, also known as the Malawi Cichlid or the Humbug Cichlid, is a species of freshwater fish belonging to the family Cichlidae. It is native to Lake Malawi in Africa, where it is found in the southern portion of the lake.

Astatotilapia calliptera is a small to medium-sized cichlid, typically reaching a maximum length of around 10-12 cm. The species exhibits a distinctive coloration pattern, with a dark vertical bars or "humbugs" on a light-colored body, which gives it its common name. The fins are often brightly colored, ranging from yellow to orange and red.

These cichlids are known to be relatively hardy and adaptable, able to thrive in a variety of aquarium conditions. They are often kept in aquariums and are popular among hobbyists due to their unique appearance and interesting social behaviors.

Astatotilapia calliptera is an important component of the diverse cichlid community found in Lake Malawi, playing a role in the ecosystem's intricate food web and contributing to the lake's overall biodiversity.
